fields.description:
The information here is not correct as all fields are getting cleared when you select the option of create another and try to create multiple issues. We are facing this problem. Is there any workaround for a time being?

We are on Jira server edition of version 6.3.4

For us few teams are creating more than 200 issues in a go and then it will be very important for them to retain the custom field value. In documentation I saw that Summary, Descriptions & time tracking are the only fields which will be cleared when create another is selected. So please correct the documentation also https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+an+Issue

Increase the priority of this bug to critical or blocker as this is not communicated to users.

Thanks,
Amit
fields.summary: This issue is automatically pre-populated with your previous issue details, while leaving the Summary, Description, and Time Tracking fields blank.

fields.description:
For JIRA versions before JIRA 6.3.6, it used to be possible to assign issues to a user, even though the user didn't initially have the security level permissions to see the issue. 
* The advantage of this previous configuration is that if you have 'Current Assignee' added to your security level, the user automatically is able to get access to the issue as soon as he is assigned.
However, in JIRA 6.3.6 this is no longer possible.

*Steps to reproduce*
* Set up issue security scheme for your project.
* Create an issue and restrict it to a specific security level.
* Try to assign this issue to a user who originally didn't belong to the security level.

*Expected Behaviour*
* JIRA allows you to assign the issue (as in JIRA versions before 6.3.6)

*Actual Behaviour in JIRA 6.3.6*
* You get an error "User 'xxx' cannot be assigned issues."
fields.summary: Assignable Users are no longer assignable for an issue if they don't belong to the Issue Security Level permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40121].
  {panel}

As an user, I do want to be able to remove a filter. At this moment, while you are editing a filter there is no option to remove it.

The only place where you can remove a filter is if you go to the screen with all filters, look for it (if you remember the filter name, as you cannot see the filter SQL body in this listing and to press the cogwheel to access the very well hidden delete option).

In addition to the [ Save ] button for filter we need a [ Delete ] button, that would remove the filter. This should be really easy to implement as it would just require to add some HTML code.

This design bug has additional side effects, is does increase the number of filters because almost nobody is using the too well hidden remove functionality, because is extremely hard to find it.
fields.summary: On filter editing screen there is no option to remove a filter
Permissions to move between projects and move within a project should be separated
REST API "search" action returns subtasks in wrong order

fields.summary: CachingFieldConfigContextPersister exhibits performance problems

fields.description: We are trying to finalize our upgrade to 6.2.7 and in our test version of JIRA, the star icon on the manage dashboard and manage filters does not turn yellow when you click it to mark it as a favorite.  It did in our old version of JIRA (4.4.4).  This is causing concerns and impeding our upgrade path.
fields.summary: Favorite icon on manage dashboard and manage filters page not turning to yellow
The notification for Bulk Edit operations should provide a clearer message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40112].
  {panel}

We need to review the [Choosing a Default Language|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Choosing+a+Default+Language] document and correct the following:
- There is no screen with the flags for selecting the language anymore.
- Only the languages below are bundled in a clean JIRA installation:
{noformat}
English (UK)
English (United States)
French (France)
German (Germany)
Japanese (Japan)
Spanish (Spain)
{noformat}

The following languages are only provided via plugins, which might not yet be fully translated or available in the latest releases:
Chinese, Czech, Danish, Italian, Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese (Brazilian), Russian and Slovak
fields.summary: The Choosing a Default Language document is outdated.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40099].
  {panel}

When JIRA interface tries to do something via Javascript (AJAX) and cannot reach server, it does not show useful error messages to guide the user.

For example when creating a new issue after pressing  the create button, if the server connection is lost or is not completed before HTTP timeout, the create button becomes available to the user after some time and the user does not get any kind of feedback. The new issue might have been created on the server but the users keeps clicking without knowing that he is creating a new issue each time.

Same thing with session timeouts. When the user opens a create window and does not complete the form before session timeout, the user interface insists on not creating the issue but also giving no warning message.

The user interface should check the connection and give feedback to user when anything bad happens with the network. Even a message saying "The server connection is lost, I don't know what happened to your issue" is better than saying nothing.
fields.summary: Network errors do not show useful messages

When trying to download the source code from https://my.atlassian.com/download/source/jira, the jira-issue-nav-plugin source is missing from the {{dependencySources}} subdirectory. It appears to be this way since 6.3:

{noformat}
~/D/atlassian-jira-6.3.6-source ❯❯❯ find . -name '*issue*nav*'
./jira-project/jira-components/jira-webapp/src/main/webapp/includes/jira/issuenavigator
./jira-project/jira-components/jira-webapp/src/main/webapp/ui/aui-layout/issue-nav.less
...
~/D/atlassian-jira-6.2.7-source ❯❯❯ find . -name '*issue*nav*'

./dependencySources/jira-issue-nav-plugin-6.2.101-sources.jar

./jira-project/jira-components/jira-webapp/src/main/webapp/ui/aui-layout/issue-nav.less

Looking at Maven the source code can be found for those plugin versions, for example https://maven.atlassian.com/service/local/repositories/atlassian-public/content/com/atlassian/jira/jira-issue-nav-plugin/6.3.22/jira-issue-nav-plugin-6.3.22-sources.jar (JIRA 6.3.4) can be downloaded.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40084].
  {panel}

This bug is related to JRA-24633,

h3. Problem Description

When customer upload a JPEG which is large (>100MB), it requires a lot of memory to generate the Thumbnail (e.g. in avatar picker) of the image and the instance crashes with OOME.

It would be better if there is an error message or limit handling when it captures the size of the file and drop the thumbnail generation to ensure the instance is still running. Instead of allowing and later the instance crashes everytime the issue is loaded.
In case of avatar picker JIRA should reject request informing user that image is too big and that smaller image should be used.

h3. Steps to replicate

# Get a huge dimension picture file (Eg, 2988 x 5312) 
# Upload it as an avatar
# High possibility the instance will run into OOME

h3. Expected Result

To have warning telling that image is too big, or alternatively, drop the thumbnail rendering for the file with error message.

h3. Workaround

To use a smaller size image file for avatar
fields.summary: Large Image Files (> 100MB) in avatar picker causing OOME

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The wadl located at http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/jira-rest-plugin.wadl
contains entries like this:
<ns2:representation element="List of users" status="200" mediaType="application/json">

The "element" attribute contains a value with embedded spaces.

This causes SoapUI 5.0.0 to fail with:
org.apache.xmlbeans.impl.values.XmlValueOutOfRangeException: Invalid QName value: Localname not a valid NCName in 'List of users'

Replacing the values of these offending elements with values that are valid XML element names seems to make SoapUI happy.

h3. Expected results
The "element" attribute contains no embedded spaces.

h3. Actual results
The "element" attribute contains multiple values with embedded spaces.

h3. Workaround
Replace the values so that there are no spaces, or just remove the spaces from within the *element=''"* fields.
fields.summary: WADL element names contain spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40054].
  {panel}

When a Zip Entry has no extension, the default Mimetype "text/html" is applied.
Under Windows 7 with Chrome and  Firefox, it causes that the filename is altered with the ".html" extension.
With IE11, the name is unchanged.

If the default MimeType would be set to "text/plain", we would have probably the ".txt" extension added. 

This behavior seems to be due to the mapping Mime/ContentType defined in the Registry (HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\Mime\Database\Content Type).

I did some test by changing the "Content-Disposition" but without the wanted result.

But it we apply as default the Mime Type "application/x-www-form-urlencoded" , the filename is not altered (under Windows with GC, FF and IE).
fields.summary: Zip Entries without extension should be downloaded without changing their filename extension

fields.description:
It should be noted in the documentation that if you are using two or more different applications on the same host, that contexts must be specified (on at least one or more) to differentiate them and avoid authentication/session issues with OAuth and Application Links.

For example, if you are running JIRA and FishEye on the same server, it should be:
http://localhost:8080
https://localhost:8060/fisheye (rather than http://localhost:8060)

There are more details about this at [this StackOverflow post|http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1612177/are-http-cookies-port-specific].
fields.summary: Documentation Request: Applications Using the Same Hostname Without Context

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40041].
  {panel}

For JIRA Upgrades, could we add "testing the upgrade on a staging/development environment" as mandatory for all three upgrade methods?
Currently it seems to be prescribed only for [Upgrading JIRA with a Fallback Method|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA+with+a+Fallback+Method].

JIRA upgrades are often complex due to plugins, configurations and customisation. Testing the upgrade on a development/staging environment could avoid production downtime and heartburn.

It would be nice to have it added to these upgrade methods as well.
# [Upgrading JIRA Using a Rapid Upgrade Method|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA+Using+a+Rapid+Upgrade+Method]
# [Upgrading JIRA Manually|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA+Manually]
# Also, the master documentation - [Upgrading JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA]
fields.summary: Mandatory testing of all JIRA upgrade methods with dev/staging environments

  {panel}

We are using the new Stash transition feature like this:
If a pull request is created that references an issue link, the issue will be transitioned from "In Progress" to "Review". If the reviewer does not approve the pull request, he declines the pull request and JIRA transitions the issue back to "In Progress".

Since an issue can only be assigned to a single user, the assignee can only be set to a reviewer if there is only one. I suggest that you add the following post functions that can only be used if Stash is linked to JIRA:

- Assign to single reviewer (keep assignee for multiple reviewers)
- Assign to pull request creator
- Remove assignee (could be used for multiple reviewer scenarios)
fields.summary: Stash Transitions: Add a post function to assign an issue to the reviewer

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In certain scenarios it's possible for the inline issue create plugin to consume 600-1.4gb per thread. This can cause significant performance problems with the instance.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

It is not currently known how to reproduce this issue.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA performs as normal, issues are created without problems.

h3. Actual Results

Threads consume 600+ memory - multiple threads can cause GC catalepsy or OutOfMemoryErrors.

h3. Workaround

# Browse to Manage add-ons.
# Select All add-ons.
# Search for "jira-inline-issue-create-plugin" and expand it.
# Click on disable as per the screenshot.

h3. Notes

Huge memory allocation is side effect of how the inline issue create plugin works. It takes a cartesian product of all clauses in order to evaluate which values all common to all of them. This means boards that have complicated JQL will be more likely to cause this issue to occur.
fields.summary: OutOfMemoryError / Huge Memory Requirements by the JIRA Inline Issue Create Plugin

fields.description:
The new notification feature for @mentions in an issue sends mail to
users not included in the group the comment visibility is restricted to.

This can be reproduced by the the following scenario:
 
- user A is member of the group SECURITY
- user B isn't
- user A creates a new issue, without restrictions
- user A mentions user @B in a comment
- user A doesn't want user B to read this comment, so he uses the
"restricted to" feature for comments and restricts the visibility for
this comment to the group SECURTY
- now user B can't see the comment in the issue (as expected), but
because he is mentioned he gets a mail notification with the whole
comment (which is absolutely unexpected and unwanted!)
 
This only happens, when the reporter of an issue is already part of the
SECURITY group. Otherwise the restriction works for the mail
notifications too.
 
Such a behaviour can be very serious, especially when user B would be an
external customer, who should never see such a comment.
fields.summary: Mention notifications are ignoring "restricted to" setting in comments if reporter is part of that group

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40009].
  {panel}

h3. Expected Behaviour
JIRA should automatically detect duplicated drafts of workflows and delete the duplicate.

h3. Actual Result
When the creation of a duplicated draft of a workflow occurs in the database, trying to edit the workflow or create another draft results in {{500}} errors.

h3. Steps to reproduce
It's not certain how to reproduce this or what exactly causes the duplication of the drafts. 

There's some hints on the cause being around concurrent uses of the workflows' editing feature. However, a test recently performed on our side returned no more than some {{404}} errors when two people were editing the same workflow.

h3. Diagnosis
Run the below query to find out whether you have duplicated drafts or not and also what workflows are affected by this.
{code:sql}
SELECT
	COUNT(*) AS	"# of Drafts",
	parentname AS "Workflow",
	MAX(id) AS "Duplicate" 
FROM
	jiradraftworkflows
GROUP BY 
	parentname 
HAVING 
	count(*) > 1;
{code}

h3. Workaround
Run the below query to delete the duplicated drafts.

(!) _Make sure you have an up-to-date backup of JIRA's database before performing any manual data manipulation._

{code:sql}
DELETE FROM jiradraftworkflows WHERE id IN (
	SELECT max(id) FROM jiradraftworkflows GROUP BY parentname HAVING count(*) > 1)
{code}
fields.summary: Prevent JIRA from creating duplicate draft workflows

fields.description:
When creating or comment an issue via mail handler:

# Attachments have been successfully processed it prints to the log
bq. Problem: The issue was created but the email was not deleted. This may cause duplicate issues to be created for this email. Subject <subject>
Since the were no errors it shouldn't print this to the log.
# Downloading attachment fails, typically it happens with some mail servers and with very large attachments, the attachment is only partially downloaded it will still be attached to jira issue. 
The issue should be commented on to indicate that attachment processing failed and no partial attachment is added to the issue.
# Forward email option should be respected when attachment failure occurs
fields.summary: Mail handler behavior on complete/incomplete attachment processed

fields.description:
Currently, even if analytics has been disabled and/or the privacy policy update has not been acknowledged, Atlassian Analytics will still attempt to call out to S3 to download the most up-to-date blacklist & whitelist for JIRA.

This *does not* involve sending out any data from the instance, just reading some flat lists of events that we do or do not want to collect (which are completely anonymous).

However, it makes sense to simply not download these at all if the user has opted to disable analytics, or has not yet acknowledged the privacy policy update.
fields.summary: Atlassian Analytics should not download any whitelists/blacklists unless analytics is enabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39992].
{panel}
If one of JIRA's users has its email address equals to a mail server's username, within the 'Incoming Mail' screen, the mail handler that uses this mail server doesn't work properly, specifically the 'CC Assignee' option which doesn't assign the created issue to the user whose email was on the CC field of the email sent to JIRA.
 JIRA also sends an error email to the mail handler's 'Forward Email' with the following error message:
{quote}Message appears to have been sent by JIRA. JIRA's mail handler is configured to forward these messages to avoid mail loops.
{quote}
 

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Configure a new mail server
 # Add a new user or edit an existing one and set this user's email address (within JIRA's User Management) equals to the same username used to set the new mail server
 # Configure a mail handler using the new mail server and check the 'CC Assignee' option
 # Send an email to the mail server's username and add a CC to this email (which is an existing JIRA user)

*Note*
 Even if the user does not have any access to JIRA and is not set to be an assignable user, the incoming mail handler can still set the user as the assignee, see related bug: JRASERVER-65403
 * This is due to granting "Assignable User" permission to "Application User - Any Logged in User"
fields.summary: Mail handler's 'CC Assignee' option doesn't work properly if a user has its email equals to the mail server's username

JIRA 6.3.4 is not compatible with Service Desk version 2.

When using JIRA 6.3.4, the manage add-ons page doesn't offer to upgrade Service Desk to version 2. This is because it is not compatible.

It would be nice if there was a notice saying that version 2 of Service Desk is available but JIRA has to be upgraded to be able to upgrade Service Desk to version 2. 

This suggestion should apply to all other Atlassian add-ons in the future as well so that JIRA users will be aware of new versions of add-ons which are incompatible with the current version of JIRA they are using
